m1.name: Dosa
m1.description: A crispy crepe-like dish made from fermented rice and lentil batter, usually served with sambar and chutney.

m2.name: Idli
m2.description: A steamed cake made from fermented rice and lentil batter, usually served with sambar and chutney.

m3.name: Vada
m3.description: A crispy fried snack made from a batter of lentils and spices, usually served with coconut chutney.

m4.name: Uttapam
m4.description: A thick pancake-like dish made from a batter of rice and lentils, usually topped with vegetables and served with sambar and chutney.

m5.name: Pongal
m5.description: A rice and lentil dish cooked with ghee, cashews, and spices, usually served with coconut chutney and sambar.

m6.name: Bisi Bele Bath
m6.description: A spicy and flavorful rice dish cooked with lentils, vegetables, and a special blend of spices, usually served with raita.

m7.name: Masala Dosa
m7.description: A dosa filled with a spicy potato filling, usually served with sambar and chutney.

m8.name: Sambar
m8.description: A lentil-based vegetable stew, usually served with rice or as a side dish with dosa or idli.

m9.name: Rasam
m9.description: A spicy and tangy soup made with tamarind, tomatoes, and spices, usually served with rice or as a side dish with dosa or idli.

m10.name: Payasam
m10.description: A sweet pudding made with milk, rice, vermicelli, or lentils, usually flavored with cardamom, saffron, or nuts.
